data.title: Payment methods that you can use with your Apple ID
data.meta_description: To buy apps from the App Store, use Apple subscriptions like iCloud+ and Apple Music, or buy other media from Apple, you need an Apple ID and a valid payment method. See what forms of payment are accepted in your country or region.
data.text:
Apple Pay requires two-factor authentication.

You might be asked to verify your account with the payment method provider.

When you use Apple Pay in these countries and regions, pay with any eligible card that's in Wallet on the device that you're using.

This payment method can’t be used for Family Sharing.

Mobile billing is available only with supported carriers. This list is subject to change. Learn more about carrier billing.

This payment method can't be used for AppleCare+ installment plans. You can't remove other payment methods if they're the only accepted payment method for your installment plans. In China mainland, this payment method can't be used for any AppleCare+ plan.

This payment method can't be added to your Apple ID using Apple Vision Pro.

With TrueMoney, you must provide the mobile phone number associated with your TrueMoney account.

If you receive an alert regarding a spending limit, call your carrier to set up a spending limit.
